definition: hostile/malevolence/antagonism/to view as enemy/to stand against
enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand

sentences.english: However, sach a cooperation aroused fear and hostility of the United States and other Western powers.
sentences.chinese: 同時也引起了美國等西方大國的驚恐和敵視。

sentences.english: Why are the two Koreas so hostile?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼兩個朝鮮竟會如此敵視？

sentences.english: All the buzz lately is that the Obama administration is “antibusiness.
sentences.chinese: 最近所有的雜音是奧巴馬政府“對企業持敵視態度”。

sentences.english: Stay calm and avoid the appearance of hostility or personal rejection.
sentences.chinese: 保持沉著和避免顯露出敵視或個人的鄙棄。

sentences.english: Many people say my story is too sad. Yes, that is true.
sentences.chinese: 《我們彼此敵視》是個悲哀的故事，不得善終。

sentences.english: They also carry 4) surfboards and have 5)attitudes.
sentences.chinese: 他們也帶著衝浪板，表現出敵視態度。

sentences.english: N. Korea gets hostile, then S. Korea and Vietnam get hostile to China.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮變的富有敵意，然後韓國和越南開始敵視中國。

sentences.english: Mr Obama must dispatch the canard that he is hostile to the Jewish state.
sentences.chinese: 他還必須解除他敵視猶太人國家的流言。

sentences.english: Their views have also generally been hostile to Indonesia's Christians.
sentences.chinese: 在他們的觀點中，通常也會敵視印尼的基督徒。

definition: to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
